text: Statement  in House debt debate not normally heard: " This vote, based on legislation I’ve introduced, will and must fail." - Dave Camp

text: C-SPAN this week celebrates 25 years of televising the Senate; Thursday is the anniversary of turning senators into TV stars. Sort of.
author: hillhulse

text: Critics of Patriot Act from both parties not happy that Sen. Reid used procedural end-run to block  amendments. Welcome to the Senate.
author: hillhulse

text: Wrong choice of words in my budget committee item - Senator Conrad deferring a markup 'til later, not foregoing.  Putting it off for a bit.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate Dems to forego budget markup; Sen. Conrad says budget may have to incorporate results of  debt talks. GOP will not be happy.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Reid says Senate Republicans to get chance very soon to vote on  House GOP/Ryan budget; Dems eager to capitalize on Gingrich remarks.
author: hillhulse

text: @HotlineReid  thanks for props -will point out your assessment to Rahm!
author: hillhulse

text: Oil execs from Chevron, Shell, BP, Conoco and Exxon agree to appear Thursday before Senate Finance Committee; should be quite a show.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen.  McConnell  sure deep-sixed the Gang of Six  today - said talks that can lead to a debt deal are the ones being led by VP Biden.
author: hillhulse

text: After mixed signals this week, House GOP issues statement  of unity behind GOP/Ryan budget in debt talks.  "Been and remains" party stance.
author: hillhulse

text: Phil Gramm tells Finance Com that deficit debate 'eerily similar' to 1985 gramm-rudman era; says US must face up debt or be overcome by it
author: hillhulse

text: Senate resolution honoring military and intel operatives  says  death of OBL  "represents a measure of justice." Sens to vote from desks .
author: hillhulse

text: Senate could vote as early as Tuesday on resolution honoring those involved in assault against Osama Bin Laden in Pakistan, Sen. Reid says
author: hillhulse

text: Everything new is old again - LBJ and the debt limit.  http://nyti.ms/iqWnFv
author: hillhulse

text: A casually dressed  John Ensign spotted in Senate corridor;  evidently closing down shop while his soon to be ex-colleagues are on recess.
author: hillhulse

text: @JasonIsbell big fan of yours but that is def from guilty. Best listened to after 3 am.  Baby I'm guilty ..
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. McConnell makes clear where he stands on talk of ending oil subsidies. - against.  GOP leader says move would increase consumer costs.
author: hillhulse

text: Would Sen.  McCain, born in Panama Canal Zone, have been eligible to run for president under his home state's vetoed 'birther' bill?
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Kyl and Rep. Cantor to be representatives of Congressional GOP leadership at deficit talks with VP Biden. Neither likes taxes.
author: hillhulse

text: Budget chair Ryan calls president's deficit speech excessively partisan, inaccurate and inadequate. These negotiations shld be interestng
author: hillhulse

text: Speaker Boehner says he hopes president's defict speech offers "specific solutions'"  not "empty promises.” Says Ryan plan set the bar.
author: hillhulse

text: Speaker Boehn er saying clearly today that the $33 billion in cuts Democrats have been focused on is not enough; talks in disarray.
author: hillhulse

text: Not exactly a killer pace in the  Senate this week per @jestei, a close watcher of the Senate activity level:  http://tinyurl.com/3gfby95
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Schumer discovers the hazards of pre-conference calls. From @jestei  ...http://tinyurl.com/66xmmfl
author: hillhulse

text: Budget fight heating up: Speaker Boehner and House GOP leadership plan Tuesday presser to go after Dems on spending. So much for talks.
author: hillhulse

text: Congressional officials say  Secs. Clinton and Gates and Adm. Mullen to provide classified briefing Wednesday for all lawmakers on Libya.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Kucinich  to offer amendment to cut off money for Libyan operation at first opportunity;   questions criteria for intervention.
author: hillhulse

text: Speaker Boehner sends tough letter on Libya to W.H.;  cites lack of clarity over mission objectives and  U.S. national security interests
author: hillhulse

text: Top  Senate Dems Durbin, Levin and Reed defend President Obama on handling of Libya; Say Pres was cautious , thoughtful and prudent.
author: hillhulse

text: Lots of  colorful metaphors in House debate on CR -  lurching like drunken sailor, no way to run a railroad,  water torture,  pile of crap.
author: hillhulse

text: Repub. Study Committee chair Jim Jordan says he will oppose new three-week CR . Does House leadership  have votes for the stop-gap?
author: hillhulse

text: Dems Ben Nelson and Claire McCaskill to vote against both budget bills today; Nelson says Dem measure timid, GOP plan  has "too much hate."
author: hillhulse

text: With Speaker Boehner sitting alongside Sen. Inouye, the approps chair, at joint meeting of House, maybe they can cut a quick spending deal.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen Reid accuses Republicans of breaking word to allow dueling budget votes without a fight - a felonious charge in Senate terms.
author: hillhulse

text: Leader Cantor  says House GOP intends to keep cutting $2 billion a week until they can reach a deal with Senate, W.H. over spending.
author: hillhulse

text: Former Pres. Bush at Senate unveiling of portrait of Bill Frist - 'It takes a really good friend to get me to come back to Washington.'
author: hillhulse

text: ESPN  counting down to expiration of NFL labor contract on March 4. Should there be a clock for end of Congressional C.R. on the same day?
author: hillhulse

text: More than 400 amendments filed to House spending bill and new ones could still come today. Might take a while to sift through all those.
author: hillhulse

text: Leader Cantor says WH budget misses opportunity; doesn't live up to State of the Union. "Page out of same old playbook.''
author: hillhulse

text: House GOP says search for more cuts to appease conservatives could delay planned roll out today of spending bill, altering timetable.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Jim Webb of VA not seeking re-election; big blow to Dem efforts to hold majority in the Senate. Seat could slip to GOP.
author: hillhulse

text: Speaker Boehner on surprise floor Patriot Act setback: New GOP majority not going to be perfect every day. House works its will.
author: hillhulse

text: Next move for House GOP: order committees to review admin regs with  'respect to their effect on jobs and economic growth.'
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Jon Tester jumps into meaty Taco Bell fray. Says chain should 'beef up' with Montana cattle. A butcher, he brings his own cuts to DC.
author: hillhulse

text: In exchange for Senate Dems not forcing showdown on rules changes,  Sen. McConnell promises he  wont try the same in the future, Dems say
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Reid promises to use 'restraint' in blocking Republicans from offering amendments  as Senate moves toward an agreement on rules.
author: hillhulse

text: Journalistid laptops in the chamber for the State of the Union are a HUGE change; major technological progress. Civility runs deep.
author: hillhulse

text: So much for healthy eating habits: 25 pizzas and 10 boxes of donuts consumed by voters in today's  cong. correspondents committee election.
author: hillhulse

text: One senator says pressure to find a bipartisan seatmate for SOTU has touched off a  frenzy as  lawmakers scurry for acceptable dates.
author: hillhulse

text: House returns to health care repeal debate next week; GOP says  they expect lawmakers to focus on "substantive policy differences" over law
author: hillhulse

text: Joe Shoemaker,   Durbin spokesman, author of invaluable Senate whip alert and all-around steady hand , latest top Dem staffer leaving Hill.
author: hillhulse

text: House resolution  Wed will  condemn 'horrific'  attack in Az, reaffirm  principle of right to assemble and honor those  hurt and killed.
author: hillhulse

text: We the People will be watching: Public reading of the Constitution by House members is set to begin at approximately 11 a.m. Thursday.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen.  DeMint compares Democratic Congress to fired employee  who should have been escorted out immediately rather than stay for lame duck.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Reid said there is a way to complete START treaty by Wednesday . Passage over GOP leadership objections would be big White House win.
author: hillhulse

text: A weekend session in the Senate on the Saturday before Christmas - nothing quite like it. Feels like 2009 all over again.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen.  Reid:  The little Constitution that we have doesn't have a lot of information in it, but  ...   it is what runs this country.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate bracing for overnight session with predictions that Republicans will force reading of 1,900 page omnibus spending measure.
author: hillhulse

text: Brendan Daly, longtime spokesman and adviser to Speaker Pelosi, leaving hill for private public relations firm. A vet of message wars.
author: hillhulse

text: Decision by House Dems to try one  more time on 'don't ask' leaves open slim chance that Pentagon ban on gays could be lifted this year.
author: hillhulse

text: A change is gonna come. GOP says they will move House Approps Committee out  of prime Capitol space.  http://tinyurl.com/32bzql2
author: hillhulse

text: Chris Van Hollen will speak for House Dems at tax talks, speaker's office says. So it is Sens. Baucus and Kyl; Reps. Van Hollen and Camp.
author: hillhulse

text: Senator Baucus, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, will represent Senate Dems in new tax talks, officials say..
author: hillhulse

text: Swearing in of Mark Kirk as the new senator from Illinois means there is again no African American of either party serving in the Senate.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. McConnell, long a champion of earmarks, said he will lead by example and give up his pursuit of home state  projects.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Clyburn not inclined to take Dem Caucus chairmanship to defuse leadership fight. "I been there," he said in brief hallway chat.
author: hillhulse

text: Despite resistance from a growing number of her own colleagues ,  Speaker Pelosi said she will run to remain head of  House Democrats.
author: hillhulse

text: NYT political team  moves Connecticut Sen race to lean Dem from tossup; some  Dem House  shifts, including John Dingell, as well. #ctsen
author: hillhulse

text: Senate Dems say no vote on extension of Bush tax cuts prior to the election.  Sen. Reid's office said tax fight will occur in lame duck.
author: hillhulse

text: That didn't take long: Senate GOP committee already sending out unflattering stories on Sen. Murkowski, a party leader until Friday.
author: hillhulse

text: It is obviously campaign time -  No votes in the House on Tuesday, with first votes put off until Wed. evening.  Now that is a short week.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Reid sets Senate procedural showdown vote for next Tuesday afternoon on Pentagon measure that would repeal "don't ask,, don't tell."
author: hillhulse

text: Dems can't praise Sen. Voinovich  enough for breakthrough on small biz ;  Sen. Landrieu said he isnt 'led around by the nose" like others
author: hillhulse

text: Club for Growth going to Joe Miller's aid in Alaska; wants to cut into Sen. Murkowki's money and manpower edge in any ballot fight.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Boehner to call for firing Sec. Geithner, Larry Summers in economic speech this morning at City Club of Cleveland.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate adjourns after  31-minute session to pass $600M in border money and remember Ted Stevens;  Should be it until Sept. 13 at 2:30 p.m.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Schumer only one on the floor in truncated Senate session and is seizing the moment Giving 30-minute explanation of his border bill.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate leaders looking at Thursday for brief session to pass $600M in border security money by consent; AZ dems will be very happy.
author: hillhulse

text: Speaker Pelosi and top Dems unhappy with Rep. Rangel's surprise floor show, see it as out of place and hurting message on jobs bill.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate leadership now trying to figure out if they could pass $600 million in new border money by a unanimous consent next week,
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Kirkpatrick of Arizona  says Senate should return to pass border money just like House came back to take care  of teacher/state money.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep.  Obey, chair of  Appropriations Committee, to vote 'no' on war supplemental,  signaling just how deep party division goes over war.
author: hillhulse

text: No TV coverage expected to be allowed for Sen. Byrd's Senate services Thurs. though he championed CSPAN in '86.  TV types appealing stance.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate Dem officials say they are trying to speed through Gen. Petraeus nomination as new Afghan commander as  quickly as tonight.
author: hillhulse

text: Extended moment of silence for Sen.  Byrd as Senate convenes; Sen. Inouye sworn in as president pro tem. Sen. Reid remembers Sen. Byrd.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Byrd's desk draped in black cloth with a vase of white roses as Senate prepares to open a session that will surely be devoted to him.
author: hillhulse

text: The office of Sen. Robert C. Byrd reports he is "seriously ill" in Washington hospital after first being admitted for heat exhaustion.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep.  Hoyer announces the House  will wrap up for summer by July 30; now won't be  votes first week of August. Time to get campaigning.
author: hillhulse

text: Iconic Capitol Dome to get a facelift beginning next week with a paint job. Capitol architect reports cast-iron dome weighs 9 million lbs.
author: hillhulse

text: Sharron Angle speaks to Sen Repubs at private weekly lunch but not to the media. She skedaddled out chased by journos but refused to talk,
author: hillhulse

text: General Petraeus tentatively scheduled to resume testimony before Sen. Armed Services Wednesday a.m., according  to Senate staff.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen Dems exploring jobless pay cut: http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/06/15/senate-democrats-might-change-jobs-bill/?ref=politics
author: hillhulse

text: Republican Tom Graves of Georgia just sworn in as newest House member; says time to curb federal spending. Brings House membership to 433.
author: hillhulse

text: Still jarring to see Republican Party of Florida issuing releases slamming Gov. Crist. Not long ago he was the  RPOF.  GOP hit him on veto.
author: hillhulse

text: Murkowski effort to block EPA authority on greenhouse gases is itself blocked on 53 to 47 vote; 6 dems sided with her. Sen. Byrd did not.
author: hillhulse

text: GOP officials say Rep. Boehner challenged President Obama on federal spending, health care legislation during bipartisan WH  session today.
author: hillhulse

text: Intensifying Senate climate change/EPA debate:  Sen. Carper says global warming will turn Dover, DE NASCAR race into a sailing regatta.
author: hillhulse

text: GOP senatorial committee has reached out to Sharron Angle in Nevada - evidently hasn't heard back. Relationship should be interesting
author: hillhulse

text: Harry Reid says blown perfect game a morality tale: lesson that corporate America - even members of Congress - should take responsibility.
author: hillhulse

text: @Taylor_West You reinforce my point!  It shows how deep the anti-incumbency thing is when folks vote against  offspring of  old  incumbents.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Kucinich pens tough letter to WH on Israel. Says self defense "doesn't extend to shooting innocent civilians anywhere in the world."
author: hillhulse

text: Backhanded compliment category: Rep. Cantor doesn't like contents of president's Pittsburgh speech but says pres "gives a good speech."
author: hillhulse

text: Political names not what they used to be. Sons of former Sen. Domenici and former Rep. Hilliard finished poorly in NM gov, Ala. house races.
author: hillhulse

text: Primary matters: Will Parker Griffith face runoff ?  Does Bobby Bright get  NRCC or Tea Party candidate ? Angela McGlowan or not in Miss?
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Frank says Israeli army has no ban on gay and lesbians serving and has the most effective fighting force in the world.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep.  Gohmert delivers fiery floor speech against  DADT- "Military is not a social experiment." Says repeal would encourage overt behavior.
author: hillhulse

text: House Dems  still unsure whether amendment on don't ask-don't tell would reach floor Thursday or come up Friday during  review of  DOD bill.
author: hillhulse

text: With swearing-in of GOP Rep.  Charles  Djou of Hawaii, House back to 432 members.  3 vacancies are districts of Reps. Massa, Deal and Souder
author: hillhulse

text: GOP senator in luncheon with President Obama says he and Republicans engaged in a "very tough exchange."  On way out, pres called it  frank.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Hoyer defends wh response on spill as very substantial; says 'British Petroleum' has  main responsibility; says Jindal seeking cover
author: hillhulse

text: House dems now say tax extenders -jobless benefits bill will not hit floor until Wed. Going to be tight to squeeze thru Senate by Friday.
author: hillhulse

text: WH gives strong endorsement to tax extenders bill that could hit House floor Tuesday.  Says higher tax rates on hedge fund mangers sensible.
author: hillhulse

text: Democrats clapped especially loudly for Mark Critz as he was sworn in to the House just now, seeing him as a sign they are not dead yet.
author: hillhulse

text: Rep. Markey to carry a live feed of B.P. Gulf spill on committee website at www.globalwarming.house.gov. as of tonight. Call it must-sea TV.
author: hillhulse

text: June 28 hearing date for Kagan a slight surprise. Most expected it would follow July 4 recess. Dems push timetable, Sen Sessions not pleased
author: hillhulse

text: Former VP and Sen. Mondale to call for filibuster changes at Wednesday a.m. hearing of Rules Committee. Says lower threshold to 55 or 56.
author: hillhulse

text: If Souder replacement is 'handpicked" by Hoosier GOP, does that take steam from GOP gripes Ellsworth was tapped by insiders to sub for Bayh?
author: hillhulse

text: White House to send up new TSA nominee today. John S. Pistole, deputy director of the F.B.I., selected for increasingly high profile job.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Reid ready to pull the cloture trigger on financial overhaul: "This cannot be delayed any longer," he said as the Senate opened today.
author: hillhulse

text: Top question on Capitol Hill today - just how big is it? Lawmakers demand that BP come clean on size of spill and amount to make landfall.
author: hillhulse

text: Who says Congress isn't sexy - If House Dems don't find a way around GOP porn motions to recommit, passing bills will be real dirty work.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Scott Brown said Elena Kagan gave satisfactory answer on role in limiting recruiting at Harvard and he does not think her anti-military
author: hillhulse

text: GOP Leader Boehner says "politicians beware" this year. Of course he thinks voter backlash due mostly to 'arrogance' of Democratic majority.
author: hillhulse

text: Dems say Mollohan W.Va. loss should be a wake-up call to their complacent incumbents; expect plenty of panic among worried House members
author: hillhulse

text: Next big GOP target - the U.S. 'bailout' of Greece through IMF. Operatives say they see this a way to keep the anti-bailout fever raging.
author: hillhulse

text: RNC's Kagan talking points list areas of conflict: military recruiters, embrace of 'liberal agenda' and claim Constitution was defective.
author: hillhulse

text: Hill GOP trying to get out ahead of improving unemployment numbers due Friday by attributing much of the gain to Census and temp gov jobs.
author: hillhulse

text: The night of the House health vote, Rep. Obey said it was what he had come to Congress to do 40 yrs ago so retirement not total shock.
author: hillhulse

text: Sen. Reid railed on floor about GOP refusal to allow votes on Wall Street overhaul. Says Dems will be patient but seemed like his was thin.
author: hillhulse

text: Lots of discussion in the closed weekly lunch of Republican senators as to whether the NYC bombing suspect should have been mirandized.
author: hillhulse

text: Marco Rubio in D.C. raising money and meeting with conservatives. Talked to NRSC over weekend. Not deadset against future offshore drilling.
author: hillhulse

text: Fla. Sen. Bill Nelson, joining other Dems, declares WH plan for new offshore drilling DOA; admin to brief Senate on spill this afternoon.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate energy committee moving its hearing on Gulf oil spill to next Tuesday stead of this Thursday as hill gears up to investigate crisis.
author: hillhulse

text: Senate's open for business. Sen. McConnell calls oil crisis in the Gulf 'heartbreaking' and hopes region can avoid worst-case scenario.
author: hillhulse

text: With spending bills coming, watch more Dems push to restore annual drilling ban that was dropped in 08 after GOP gained upper hand on oil
author: hillhulse

text: Real party switching tradition in Fla - Andy Ireland (good move), Bill Grant (not so good), Bob Martinez (good at first). Must be climate.
author: hillhulse

text: Awaiting oddly late immigration presser. Dems wonder how they can secure enough GOP votes on issue when Bush WH and Senator McCain couldn't.
author: hillhulse

text: now on twitterverse; hope don't regret it. Will try to provide scooplets and not shame NYT  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=os0F4-XFf6w
